71    @Test (timeout=180000)
72    public void testShouldCheckMasterFailOverWhenMETAIsInOpenedState()
73        throws Exception {
74      LOG.info("Starting testShouldCheckMasterFailOverWhenMETAIsInOpenedState");
75      final int NUM_MASTERS = 1;
76      final int NUM_RS = 2;
77  
78      Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
79      conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.period", 2000);
80      conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.timeout", 8000);
81      // Start the cluster
82      HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility(conf);
83  
84      TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster(NUM_MASTERS, NUM_RS);
85      MiniHBaseCluster cluster = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster();
86  
87      // Find regionserver carrying meta.
88      List<RegionServerThread> regionServerThreads =
89        cluster.getRegionServerThreads();
90      int count = -1;
91      HRegion metaRegion = null;
92      for (RegionServerThread regionServerThread : regionServerThreads) {
93        HRegionServer regionServer = regionServerThread.getRegionServer();
94        metaRegion = regionServer.getOnlineRegion(HRegionInfo.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO.getRegionName());
95        count++;
96        regionServer.abort("");
97        if (null != metaRegion) break;
98      }
99      HRegionServer regionServer = cluster.getRegionServer(count);
100 
101     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniHBaseCluster();
102 
103     // Create a ZKW to use in the test
104     ZooKeeperWatcher zkw = 
105       HBaseTestingUtility.createAndForceNodeToOpenedState(TEST_UTIL, 
106           metaRegion, regionServer.getServerName());
107 
108     LOG.info("Staring cluster for second time");
109     TEST_UTIL.startMiniHBaseCluster(NUM_MASTERS, NUM_RS);
110 
111     HMaster master = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster().getMaster();
112     while (!master.isInitialized()) {
113       Thread.sleep(100);
114     }
115     // Failover should be completed, now wait for no RIT
116     log("Waiting for no more RIT");
117     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
118 
119     zkw.close();
120     // Stop the cluster
121     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
122   }

124   /**
125    * Simple test of master failover.
126    * <p>
127    * Starts with three masters.  Kills a backup master.  Then kills the active
128    * master.  Ensures the final master becomes active and we can still contact
129    * the cluster.
130    * @throws Exception
131    */
132   @Test (timeout=240000)
133   public void testSimpleMasterFailover() throws Exception {
134 
135     final int NUM_MASTERS = 3;
136     final int NUM_RS = 3;
137 
138     // Create config to use for this cluster
139     Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
140 
141     // Start the cluster
142     HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility(conf);
143     TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster(NUM_MASTERS, NUM_RS);
144     MiniHBaseCluster cluster = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster();
145 
146     // get all the master threads
147     List<MasterThread> masterThreads = cluster.getMasterThreads();
148 
149     // wait for each to come online
150     for (MasterThread mt : masterThreads) {
151       assertTrue(mt.isAlive());
152     }
153 
154     // verify only one is the active master and we have right number
155     int numActive = 0;
156     int activeIndex = -1;
157     ServerName activeName = null;
158     HMaster active = null;
159     for (int i = 0; i < masterThreads.size(); i++) {
160       if (masterThreads.get(i).getMaster().isActiveMaster()) {
161         numActive++;
162         activeIndex = i;
163         active = masterThreads.get(activeIndex).getMaster();
164         activeName = active.getServerName();
165       }
166     }
167     assertEquals(1, numActive);
168     assertEquals(NUM_MASTERS, masterThreads.size());
169     LOG.info("Active master " + activeName);
170 
171     // Check that ClusterStatus reports the correct active and backup masters
172     assertNotNull(active);
173     ClusterStatus status = active.getClusterStatus();
174     assertTrue(status.getMaster().equals(activeName));
175     assertEquals(2, status.getBackupMastersSize());
176     assertEquals(2, status.getBackupMasters().size());
177 
178     // attempt to stop one of the inactive masters
179     int backupIndex = (activeIndex == 0 ? 1 : activeIndex - 1);
180     HMaster master = cluster.getMaster(backupIndex);
181     LOG.debug("\n\nStopping a backup master: " + master.getServerName() + "\n");
182     cluster.stopMaster(backupIndex, false);
183     cluster.waitOnMaster(backupIndex);
184 
185     // Verify still one active master and it's the same
186     for (int i = 0; i < masterThreads.size(); i++) {
187       if (masterThreads.get(i).getMaster().isActiveMaster()) {
188         assertTrue(activeName.equals(masterThreads.get(i).getMaster().getServerName()));
189         activeIndex = i;
190         active = masterThreads.get(activeIndex).getMaster();
191       }
192     }
193     assertEquals(1, numActive);
194     assertEquals(2, masterThreads.size());
195     int rsCount = masterThreads.get(activeIndex).getMaster().getClusterStatus().getServersSize();
196     LOG.info("Active master " + active.getServerName() + " managing " + rsCount +  " regions servers");
197     assertEquals(3, rsCount);
198 
199     // Check that ClusterStatus reports the correct active and backup masters
200     assertNotNull(active);
201     status = active.getClusterStatus();
202     assertTrue(status.getMaster().equals(activeName));
203     assertEquals(1, status.getBackupMastersSize());
204     assertEquals(1, status.getBackupMasters().size());
205 
206     // kill the active master
207     LOG.debug("\n\nStopping the active master " + active.getServerName() + "\n");
208     cluster.stopMaster(activeIndex, false);
209     cluster.waitOnMaster(activeIndex);
210 
211     // wait for an active master to show up and be ready
212     assertTrue(cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster());
213 
214     LOG.debug("\n\nVerifying backup master is now active\n");
215     // should only have one master now
216     assertEquals(1, masterThreads.size());
217 
218     // and he should be active
219     active = masterThreads.get(0).getMaster();
220     assertNotNull(active);
221     status = active.getClusterStatus();
222     ServerName mastername = status.getMaster();
223     assertTrue(mastername.equals(active.getServerName()));
224     assertTrue(active.isActiveMaster());
225     assertEquals(0, status.getBackupMastersSize());
226     assertEquals(0, status.getBackupMasters().size());
227     int rss = status.getServersSize();
228     LOG.info("Active master " + mastername.getServerName() + " managing " +
229       rss +  " region servers");
230     assertEquals(3, rss);
231 
232     // Stop the cluster
233     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
234   }

236   /**
237    * Complex test of master failover that tests as many permutations of the
238    * different possible states that regions in transition could be in within ZK.
239    * <p>
240    * This tests the proper handling of these states by the failed-over master
241    * and includes a thorough testing of the timeout code as well.
242    * <p>
243    * Starts with a single master and three regionservers.
244    * <p>
245    * Creates two tables, enabledTable and disabledTable, each containing 5
246    * regions.  The disabledTable is then disabled.
247    * <p>
248    * After reaching steady-state, the master is killed.  We then mock several
249    * states in ZK.
250    * <p>
251    * After mocking them, we will startup a new master which should become the
252    * active master and also detect that it is a failover.  The primary test
253    * passing condition will be that all regions of the enabled table are
254    * assigned and all the regions of the disabled table are not assigned.
255    * <p>
256    * The different scenarios to be tested are below:
257    * <p>
258    * <b>ZK State:  OFFLINE</b>
259    * <p>A node can get into OFFLINE state if</p>
260    * <ul>
261    * <li>An RS fails to open a region, so it reverts the state back to OFFLINE
262    * <li>The Master is assigning the region to a RS before it sends RPC
263    * </ul>
264    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
265    * <ul>
266    * <li>Master has assigned an enabled region but RS failed so a region is
267    *     not assigned anywhere and is sitting in ZK as OFFLINE</li>
268    * <li>This seems to cover both cases?</li>
269    * </ul>
270    * <p>
271    * <b>ZK State:  CLOSING</b>
272    * <p>A node can get into CLOSING state if</p>
273    * <ul>
274    * <li>An RS has begun to close a region
275    * </ul>
276    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
277    * <ul>
278    * <li>Region of enabled table was being closed but did not complete
279    * <li>Region of disabled table was being closed but did not complete
280    * </ul>
281    * <p>
282    * <b>ZK State:  CLOSED</b>
283    * <p>A node can get into CLOSED state if</p>
284    * <ul>
285    * <li>An RS has completed closing a region but not acknowledged by master yet
286    * </ul>
287    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
288    * <ul>
289    * <li>Region of a table that should be enabled was closed on an RS
290    * <li>Region of a table that should be disabled was closed on an RS
291    * </ul>
292    * <p>
293    * <b>ZK State:  OPENING</b>
294    * <p>A node can get into OPENING state if</p>
295    * <ul>
296    * <li>An RS has begun to open a region
297    * </ul>
298    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
299    * <ul>
300    * <li>RS was opening a region of enabled table but never finishes
301    * </ul>
302    * <p>
303    * <b>ZK State:  OPENED</b>
304    * <p>A node can get into OPENED state if</p>
305    * <ul>
306    * <li>An RS has finished opening a region but not acknowledged by master yet
307    * </ul>
308    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
309    * <ul>
310    * <li>Region of a table that should be enabled was opened on an RS
311    * <li>Region of a table that should be disabled was opened on an RS
312    * </ul>
313    * @throws Exception
314    */
315   @Test (timeout=180000)
316   public void testMasterFailoverWithMockedRIT() throws Exception {
317 
318     final int NUM_MASTERS = 1;
319     final int NUM_RS = 3;
320 
321     // Create config to use for this cluster
322     Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
323     // Need to drop the timeout much lower
324     conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.period", 2000);
325     conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.timeout", 4000);
326     conf.setInt(ServerManager.WAIT_ON_REGIONSERVERS_MINTOSTART, 3);
327     conf.setInt(ServerManager.WAIT_ON_REGIONSERVERS_MAXTOSTART, 3);
328 
329     // Start the cluster
330     HBaseTestingUtility TEST_UTIL = new HBaseTestingUtility(conf);
331     TEST_UTIL.startMiniCluster(NUM_MASTERS, NUM_RS);
332     MiniHBaseCluster cluster = TEST_UTIL.getHBaseCluster();
333     log("Cluster started");
334 
335     // Create a ZKW to use in the test
336     ZooKeeperWatcher zkw = HBaseTestingUtility.getZooKeeperWatcher(TEST_UTIL);
337 
338     // get all the master threads
339     List<MasterThread> masterThreads = cluster.getMasterThreads();
340     assertEquals(1, masterThreads.size());
341 
342     // only one master thread, let's wait for it to be initialized
343     assertTrue(cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster());
344     HMaster master = masterThreads.get(0).getMaster();
345     assertTrue(master.isActiveMaster());
346     assertTrue(master.isInitialized());
347 
348     // disable load balancing on this master
349     master.balanceSwitch(false);
350 
351     // create two tables in META, each with 10 regions
352     byte [] FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("family");
353     byte [][] SPLIT_KEYS = new byte [][] {
354         new byte[0], Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"),
355         Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"),
356         Bytes.toBytes("fff"), Bytes.toBytes("ggg"), Bytes.toBytes("hhh"),
357         Bytes.toBytes("iii"), Bytes.toBytes("jjj")
358     };
359 
360     byte [] enabledTable = Bytes.toBytes("enabledTable");
361     HTableDescriptor htdEnabled = new HTableDescriptor(enabledTable);
362     htdEnabled.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILY));
363 
364     FileSystem filesystem = FileSystem.get(conf);
365     Path rootdir = filesystem.makeQualified(
366         new Path(conf.get(HConstants.HBASE_DIR)));
367     // Write the .tableinfo
368     FSTableDescriptors.createTableDescriptor(filesystem, rootdir, htdEnabled);
369 
370     HRegionInfo hriEnabled = new HRegionInfo(htdEnabled.getName(), null, null);
371     createRegion(hriEnabled, rootdir, conf, htdEnabled);
372 
373     List<HRegionInfo> enabledRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionsInMeta(
374         TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htdEnabled, SPLIT_KEYS);
375 
376     byte [] disabledTable = Bytes.toBytes("disabledTable");
377     HTableDescriptor htdDisabled = new HTableDescriptor(disabledTable);
378     htdDisabled.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILY));
379     // Write the .tableinfo
380     FSTableDescriptors.createTableDescriptor(filesystem, rootdir, htdDisabled);
381     HRegionInfo hriDisabled = new HRegionInfo(htdDisabled.getName(), null, null);
382     createRegion(hriDisabled, rootdir, conf, htdDisabled);
383     List<HRegionInfo> disabledRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionsInMeta(
384         TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htdDisabled, SPLIT_KEYS);
385 
386     log("Regions in META have been created");
387 
388     // at this point we only expect 2 regions to be assigned out (catalogs)
389     assertEquals(2, cluster.countServedRegions());
390 
391     // Let's just assign everything to first RS
392     HRegionServer hrs = cluster.getRegionServer(0);
393     ServerName serverName = hrs.getServerName();
394     HRegionInfo closingRegion = enabledRegions.remove(0);
395     // we'll need some regions to already be assigned out properly on live RS
396     List<HRegionInfo> enabledAndAssignedRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
397     enabledAndAssignedRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
398     enabledAndAssignedRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
399     enabledAndAssignedRegions.add(closingRegion);
400 
401     List<HRegionInfo> disabledAndAssignedRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
402     disabledAndAssignedRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
403     disabledAndAssignedRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
404 
405     // now actually assign them
406     for (HRegionInfo hri : enabledAndAssignedRegions) {
407       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
408           new RegionPlan(hri, null, serverName));
409       master.assignRegion(hri);
410     }
411     for (HRegionInfo hri : disabledAndAssignedRegions) {
412       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
413           new RegionPlan(hri, null, serverName));
414       master.assignRegion(hri);
415     }
416 
417     // wait for no more RIT
418     log("Waiting for assignment to finish");
419     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
420     log("Assignment completed");
421 
422     // Stop the master
423     log("Aborting master");
424     cluster.abortMaster(0);
425     cluster.waitOnMaster(0);
426     log("Master has aborted");
427 
428     /*
429      * Now, let's start mocking up some weird states as described in the method
430      * javadoc.
431      */
432 
433     List<HRegionInfo> regionsThatShouldBeOnline = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
434     List<HRegionInfo> regionsThatShouldBeOffline = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
435 
436     log("Beginning to mock scenarios");
437 
438     // Disable the disabledTable in ZK
439     ZKTable zktable = new ZKTable(zkw);
440     zktable.setDisabledTable(Bytes.toString(disabledTable));
441 
442     /*
443      *  ZK = OFFLINE
444      */
445 
446     // Region that should be assigned but is not and is in ZK as OFFLINE
447     HRegionInfo region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
448     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
449     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, serverName);
450 
451     /*
452      * ZK = CLOSING
453      */
454     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(closingRegion);
455     ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, closingRegion, serverName);
456 
457     /*
458      * ZK = CLOSED
459      */
460 
461     // Region of enabled table closed but not ack
462     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
463     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
464     int version = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, serverName);
465     ZKAssign.transitionNodeClosed(zkw, region, serverName, version);
466 
467     // Region of disabled table closed but not ack
468     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
469     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
470     version = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, serverName);
471     ZKAssign.transitionNodeClosed(zkw, region, serverName, version);
472 
473     /*
474      * ZK = OPENING
475      */
476 
477     // RS was opening a region of enabled table but never finishes
478     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
479     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
480     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, serverName);
481     ZKAssign.transitionNodeOpening(zkw, region, serverName);
482 
483     /*
484      * ZK = OPENED
485      */
486 
487     // Region of enabled table was opened on RS
488     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
489     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
490     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, serverName);
491     hrs.openRegion(region);
492     while (true) {
493       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
494       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
495         break;
496       }
497       Thread.sleep(100);
498     }
499 
500     // Region of disable table was opened on RS
501     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
502     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
503     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, serverName);
504     hrs.openRegion(region);
505     while (true) {
506       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
507       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
508         break;
509       }
510       Thread.sleep(100);
511     }
512 
513     /*
514      * ZK = NONE
515      */
516 
517     /*
518      * DONE MOCKING
519      */
520 
521     log("Done mocking data up in ZK");
522 
523     // Start up a new master
524     log("Starting up a new master");
525     master = cluster.startMaster().getMaster();
526     log("Waiting for master to be ready");
527     cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster();
528     log("Master is ready");
529 
530     // Failover should be completed, now wait for no RIT
531     log("Waiting for no more RIT");
532     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
533     log("No more RIT in ZK, now doing final test verification");
534 
535     // Grab all the regions that are online across RSs
536     Set<HRegionInfo> onlineRegions = new TreeSet<HRegionInfo>();
537     for (JVMClusterUtil.RegionServerThread rst :
538       cluster.getRegionServerThreads()) {
539       onlineRegions.addAll(rst.getRegionServer().getOnlineRegions());
540     }
541 
542     // Now, everything that should be online should be online
543     for (HRegionInfo hri : regionsThatShouldBeOnline) {
544       assertTrue(onlineRegions.contains(hri));
545     }
546 
547     // Everything that should be offline should not be online
548     for (HRegionInfo hri : regionsThatShouldBeOffline) {
549       assertFalse(onlineRegions.contains(hri));
550     }
551 
552     log("Done with verification, all passed, shutting down cluster");
553 
554     // Done, shutdown the cluster
555     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
556   }

559   /**
560    * Complex test of master failover that tests as many permutations of the
561    * different possible states that regions in transition could be in within ZK
562    * pointing to an RS that has died while no master is around to process it.
563    * <p>
564    * This tests the proper handling of these states by the failed-over master
565    * and includes a thorough testing of the timeout code as well.
566    * <p>
567    * Starts with a single master and two regionservers.
568    * <p>
569    * Creates two tables, enabledTable and disabledTable, each containing 5
570    * regions.  The disabledTable is then disabled.
571    * <p>
572    * After reaching steady-state, the master is killed.  We then mock several
573    * states in ZK.  And one of the RS will be killed.
574    * <p>
575    * After mocking them and killing an RS, we will startup a new master which
576    * should become the active master and also detect that it is a failover.  The
577    * primary test passing condition will be that all regions of the enabled
578    * table are assigned and all the regions of the disabled table are not
579    * assigned.
580    * <p>
581    * The different scenarios to be tested are below:
582    * <p>
583    * <b>ZK State:  CLOSING</b>
584    * <p>A node can get into CLOSING state if</p>
585    * <ul>
586    * <li>An RS has begun to close a region
587    * </ul>
588    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
589    * <ul>
590    * <li>Region was being closed but the RS died before finishing the close
591    * </ul>
592    * <b>ZK State:  OPENED</b>
593    * <p>A node can get into OPENED state if</p>
594    * <ul>
595    * <li>An RS has finished opening a region but not acknowledged by master yet
596    * </ul>
597    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
598    * <ul>
599    * <li>Region of a table that should be enabled was opened by a now-dead RS
600    * <li>Region of a table that should be disabled was opened by a now-dead RS
601    * </ul>
602    * <p>
603    * <b>ZK State:  NONE</b>
604    * <p>A region could not have a transition node if</p>
605    * <ul>
606    * <li>The server hosting the region died and no master processed it
607    * </ul>
608    * <p>We will mock the scenarios</p>
609    * <ul>
610    * <li>Region of enabled table was on a dead RS that was not yet processed
611    * <li>Region of disabled table was on a dead RS that was not yet processed
612    * </ul>
613    * @throws Exception
614    */
615   @Test (timeout=180000)
616   public void testMasterFailoverWithMockedRITOnDeadRS() throws Exception {

623     // Need to drop the timeout much lower
624     conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.period", 2000);
625     conf.setInt("hbase.master.assignment.timeoutmonitor.timeout", 4000);

635     // Create a ZKW to use in the test
636     ZooKeeperWatcher zkw = new ZooKeeperWatcher(TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(),
637         "unittest", new Abortable() {
638 
639           @Override
640           public void abort(String why, Throwable e) {
641             LOG.error("Fatal ZK Error: " + why, e);
642             org.junit.Assert.assertFalse("Fatal ZK error", true);
643           }

645           @Override
646           public boolean isAborted() {

648           }

652     // get all the master threads
653     List<MasterThread> masterThreads = cluster.getMasterThreads();
654     assertEquals(1, masterThreads.size());
655 
656     // only one master thread, let's wait for it to be initialized
657     assertTrue(cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster());

659     assertTrue(master.isActiveMaster());
660     assertTrue(master.isInitialized());

665     // create two tables in META, each with 10 regions
666     byte [] FAMILY = Bytes.toBytes("family");

668         new byte[0], Bytes.toBytes("aaa"), Bytes.toBytes("bbb"),
669         Bytes.toBytes("ccc"), Bytes.toBytes("ddd"), Bytes.toBytes("eee"),
670         Bytes.toBytes("fff"), Bytes.toBytes("ggg"), Bytes.toBytes("hhh"),
671         Bytes.toBytes("iii"), Bytes.toBytes("jjj")
672     };
673 
674     byte [] enabledTable = Bytes.toBytes("enabledTable");
675     HTableDescriptor htdEnabled = new HTableDescriptor(enabledTable);
676     htdEnabled.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILY));
677     FileSystem filesystem = FileSystem.get(conf);
678     Path rootdir = filesystem.makeQualified(
679            new Path(conf.get(HConstants.HBASE_DIR)));
680     // Write the .tableinfo
681     FSTableDescriptors.createTableDescriptor(filesystem, rootdir, htdEnabled);
682     HRegionInfo hriEnabled = new HRegionInfo(htdEnabled.getName(),
683         null, null);

687         TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htdEnabled, SPLIT_KEYS);
688 
689     byte [] disabledTable = Bytes.toBytes("disabledTable");
690     HTableDescriptor htdDisabled = new HTableDescriptor(disabledTable);
691     htdDisabled.addFamily(new HColumnDescriptor(FAMILY));
692     // Write the .tableinfo
693     FSTableDescriptors.createTableDescriptor(filesystem, rootdir, htdDisabled);
694     HRegionInfo hriDisabled = new HRegionInfo(htdDisabled.getName(), null, null);
695     createRegion(hriDisabled, rootdir, conf, htdDisabled);
696 
697     List<HRegionInfo> disabledRegions = TEST_UTIL.createMultiRegionsInMeta(
698         TEST_UTIL.getConfiguration(), htdDisabled, SPLIT_KEYS);
699 
700     log("Regions in META have been created");
701 
702     // at this point we only expect 2 regions to be assigned out (catalogs)
703     assertEquals(2, cluster.countServedRegions());
704 
705     // The first RS will stay online
706     List<RegionServerThread> regionservers =
707       cluster.getRegionServerThreads();
708     HRegionServer hrs = regionservers.get(0).getRegionServer();
709 
710     // The second RS is going to be hard-killed
711     RegionServerThread hrsDeadThread = regionservers.get(1);
712     HRegionServer hrsDead = hrsDeadThread.getRegionServer();
713     ServerName deadServerName = hrsDead.getServerName();
714 
715     // we'll need some regions to already be assigned out properly on live RS
716     List<HRegionInfo> enabledAndAssignedRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
717     enabledAndAssignedRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
718     enabledAndAssignedRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
719     List<HRegionInfo> disabledAndAssignedRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
720     disabledAndAssignedRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
721     disabledAndAssignedRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
722 
723     // now actually assign them
724     for (HRegionInfo hri : enabledAndAssignedRegions) {
725       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
726           new RegionPlan(hri, null, hrs.getServerName()));
727       master.assignRegion(hri);
728     }
729     for (HRegionInfo hri : disabledAndAssignedRegions) {
730       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
731           new RegionPlan(hri, null, hrs.getServerName()));
732       master.assignRegion(hri);
733     }
734 
735     assertTrue(" Table must be enabled.", master.getAssignmentManager()
736         .getZKTable().isEnabledTable("enabledTable"));
737     // we also need regions assigned out on the dead server
738     List<HRegionInfo> enabledAndOnDeadRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
739     enabledAndOnDeadRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
740     enabledAndOnDeadRegions.add(enabledRegions.remove(0));
741     List<HRegionInfo> disabledAndOnDeadRegions = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
742     disabledAndOnDeadRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
743     disabledAndOnDeadRegions.add(disabledRegions.remove(0));
744 
745     // set region plan to server to be killed and trigger assign
746     for (HRegionInfo hri : enabledAndOnDeadRegions) {
747       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
748           new RegionPlan(hri, null, deadServerName));
749       master.assignRegion(hri);
750     }
751     for (HRegionInfo hri : disabledAndOnDeadRegions) {
752       master.assignmentManager.regionPlans.put(hri.getEncodedName(),
753           new RegionPlan(hri, null, deadServerName));
754       master.assignRegion(hri);
755     }
756 
757     // wait for no more RIT
758     log("Waiting for assignment to finish");
759     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
760     log("Assignment completed");
761 
762     // Stop the master
763     log("Aborting master");
764     cluster.abortMaster(0);
765     cluster.waitOnMaster(0);
766     log("Master has aborted");
767 
768     /*
769      * Now, let's start mocking up some weird states as described in the method
770      * javadoc.
771      */
772 
773     List<HRegionInfo> regionsThatShouldBeOnline = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
774     List<HRegionInfo> regionsThatShouldBeOffline = new ArrayList<HRegionInfo>();
775 
776     log("Beginning to mock scenarios");
777 
778     // Disable the disabledTable in ZK
779     ZKTable zktable = new ZKTable(zkw);
780     zktable.setDisabledTable(Bytes.toString(disabledTable));
781 
782     assertTrue(" The enabled table should be identified on master fail over.",
783         zktable.isEnabledTable("enabledTable"));
784 
785     /*
786      * ZK = CLOSING
787      */
788 
789     // Region of enabled table being closed on dead RS but not finished
790     HRegionInfo region = enabledAndOnDeadRegions.remove(0);
791     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
792     ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, deadServerName);
793     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of enabled table was CLOSING on dead RS\n" +
794         region + "\n\n");
795 
796     // Region of disabled table being closed on dead RS but not finished
797     region = disabledAndOnDeadRegions.remove(0);
798     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
799     ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, deadServerName);
800     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of disabled table was CLOSING on dead RS\n" +
801         region + "\n\n");
802 
803     /*
804      * ZK = CLOSED
805      */
806 
807     // Region of enabled on dead server gets closed but not ack'd by master
808     region = enabledAndOnDeadRegions.remove(0);
809     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
810     int version = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, deadServerName);
811     ZKAssign.transitionNodeClosed(zkw, region, deadServerName, version);
812     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of enabled table was CLOSED on dead RS\n" +
813         region + "\n\n");
814 
815     // Region of disabled on dead server gets closed but not ack'd by master
816     region = disabledAndOnDeadRegions.remove(0);
817     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
818     version = ZKAssign.createNodeClosing(zkw, region, deadServerName);
819     ZKAssign.transitionNodeClosed(zkw, region, deadServerName, version);
820     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of disabled table was CLOSED on dead RS\n" +
821         region + "\n\n");
822 
823     /*
824      * ZK = OPENING
825      */
826 
827     // RS was opening a region of enabled table then died
828     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
829     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
830     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
831     ZKAssign.transitionNodeOpening(zkw, region, deadServerName);
832     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of enabled table was OPENING on dead RS\n" +
833         region + "\n\n");
834 
835     // RS was opening a region of disabled table then died
836     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
837     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
838     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
839     ZKAssign.transitionNodeOpening(zkw, region, deadServerName);
840     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of disabled table was OPENING on dead RS\n" +
841         region + "\n\n");
842 
843     /*
844      * ZK = OPENED
845      */
846 
847     // Region of enabled table was opened on dead RS
848     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
849     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
850     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
851     hrsDead.openRegion(region);
852     while (true) {
853       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
854       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
855         break;
856       }
857       Thread.sleep(100);
858     }
859     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of enabled table was OPENED on dead RS\n" +
860         region + "\n\n");
861 
862     // Region of disabled table was opened on dead RS
863     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
864     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
865     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
866     hrsDead.openRegion(region);
867     while (true) {
868       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
869       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
870         break;
871       }
872       Thread.sleep(100);
873     }
874     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of disabled table was OPENED on dead RS\n" +
875         region + "\n\n");
876 
877     /*
878      * ZK = NONE
879      */
880 
881     // Region of enabled table was open at steady-state on dead RS
882     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
883     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
884     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
885     hrsDead.openRegion(region);
886     while (true) {
887       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
888       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
889         ZKAssign.deleteOpenedNode(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
890         break;
891       }
892       Thread.sleep(100);
893     }
894     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of enabled table was open at steady-state on dead RS"
895         + "\n" + region + "\n\n");
896 
897     // Region of disabled table was open at steady-state on dead RS
898     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
899     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
900     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, deadServerName);
901     hrsDead.openRegion(region);
902     while (true) {
903       RegionTransitionData rtd = ZKAssign.getData(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
904       if (rtd != null && rtd.getEventType() == EventType.RS_ZK_REGION_OPENED) {
905         ZKAssign.deleteOpenedNode(zkw, region.getEncodedName());
906         break;
907       }
908       Thread.sleep(100);
909     }
910     LOG.debug("\n\nRegion of disabled table was open at steady-state on dead RS"
911       + "\n" + region + "\n\n");
912 
913     /*
914      * DONE MOCKING
915      */
916 
917     log("Done mocking data up in ZK");
918 
919     // Kill the RS that had a hard death
920     log("Killing RS " + deadServerName);
921     hrsDead.abort("Killing for unit test");
922     log("RS " + deadServerName + " killed");
923 
924     // Start up a new master.  Wait until regionserver is completely down
925     // before starting new master because of hbase-4511.
926     while (hrsDeadThread.isAlive()) {
927       Threads.sleep(10);
928     }
929     log("Starting up a new master");
930     master = cluster.startMaster().getMaster();
931     log("Waiting for master to be ready");
932     assertTrue(cluster.waitForActiveAndReadyMaster());
933     log("Master is ready");
934 
935     // Let's add some weird states to master in-memory state
936 
937     // After HBASE-3181, we need to have some ZK state if we're PENDING_OPEN
938     // b/c it is impossible for us to get into this state w/o a zk node
939     // this is not true of PENDING_CLOSE
940 
941     // PENDING_OPEN and enabled
942     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
943     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
944     master.assignmentManager.regionsInTransition.put(region.getEncodedName(),
945         new RegionState(region, RegionState.State.PENDING_OPEN, 0, null));
946     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, master.getServerName());
947     // PENDING_OPEN and disabled
948     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
949     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
950     master.assignmentManager.regionsInTransition.put(region.getEncodedName(),
951         new RegionState(region, RegionState.State.PENDING_OPEN, 0, null));
952     ZKAssign.createNodeOffline(zkw, region, master.getServerName());
953     // This test is bad.  It puts up a PENDING_CLOSE but doesn't say what
954     // server we were PENDING_CLOSE against -- i.e. an entry in
955     // AssignmentManager#regions.  W/o a server, we NPE trying to resend close.
956     // In past, there was wonky logic that had us reassign region if no server
957     // at tail of the unassign.  This was removed.  Commenting out for now.
958     // TODO: Remove completely.
959     /*
960     // PENDING_CLOSE and enabled
961     region = enabledRegions.remove(0);
962     LOG.info("Setting PENDING_CLOSE enabled " + region.getEncodedName());
963     regionsThatShouldBeOnline.add(region);
964     master.assignmentManager.regionsInTransition.put(region.getEncodedName(),
965       new RegionState(region, RegionState.State.PENDING_CLOSE, 0));
966     // PENDING_CLOSE and disabled
967     region = disabledRegions.remove(0);
968     LOG.info("Setting PENDING_CLOSE disabled " + region.getEncodedName());
969     regionsThatShouldBeOffline.add(region);
970     master.assignmentManager.regionsInTransition.put(region.getEncodedName(),
971       new RegionState(region, RegionState.State.PENDING_CLOSE, 0));
972       */
973 
974     // Failover should be completed, now wait for no RIT
975     log("Waiting for no more RIT");
976     ZKAssign.blockUntilNoRIT(zkw);
977     log("No more RIT in ZK");
978     long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
979     final long maxTime = 120000;
980     boolean done = master.assignmentManager.waitUntilNoRegionsInTransition(maxTime);
981     if (!done) {
982       LOG.info("rit=" + master.assignmentManager.getRegionsInTransition());
983     }
984     long elapsed = System.currentTimeMillis() - now;
985     assertTrue("Elapsed=" + elapsed + ", maxTime=" + maxTime + ", done=" + done,
986       elapsed < maxTime);
987     log("No more RIT in RIT map, doing final test verification");
988 
989     // Grab all the regions that are online across RSs
990     Set<HRegionInfo> onlineRegions = new TreeSet<HRegionInfo>();
991     for (JVMClusterUtil.RegionServerThread rst :
992         cluster.getRegionServerThreads()) {
993       try {
994         onlineRegions.addAll(rst.getRegionServer().getOnlineRegions());
995       } catch (org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.RegionServerStoppedException e) {
996         LOG.info("Got RegionServerStoppedException", e);
997       }
998     }
999 
1000     // Now, everything that should be online should be online
1001     for (HRegionInfo hri : regionsThatShouldBeOnline) {
1002       assertTrue("region=" + hri.getRegionNameAsString(), onlineRegions.contains(hri));
1003     }
1004 
1005     // Everything that should be offline should not be online
1006     for (HRegionInfo hri : regionsThatShouldBeOffline) {
1007       assertFalse(onlineRegions.contains(hri));
1008     }
1009 
1010     log("Done with verification, all passed, shutting down cluster");
1011 
1012     // Done, shutdown the cluster
1013     TEST_UTIL.shutdownMiniCluster();
1014   }
1015 
1016   HRegion createRegion(final HRegionInfo  hri, final Path rootdir, final Configuration c,
1017       final HTableDescriptor htd)
1018   throws IOException {
1019     HRegion r = HRegion.createHRegion(hri, rootdir, c, htd);
1020     // The above call to create a region will create an hlog file.  Each
1021     // log file create will also create a running thread to do syncing.  We need
1022     // to close out this log else we will have a running thread trying to sync
1023     // the file system continuously which is ugly when dfs is taken away at the
1024     // end of the test.
1025     HRegion.closeHRegion(r);
1026     return r;
1027   }
